DataElement.preferredName: Patient Self-Report Race Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Yes No indicator to signify whether the patient self identifies as African American/black non-hispanic or White non-hispanic

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Major living subspecies of man differentiated by genetic and physical characteristics. There are four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid._Subjective reports made by a patient._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Major living subspecies of man differentiated by genetic and physical characteristics. There are four racial groups: Australoid, Caucasoid, Mongoloid, and Negroid.

Concepts.definition: A geographic ancestral origin category that is assigned to a population group based mainly on physical characteristics that are thought to be distinct and inherent.

Property.preferredDefinition: Subjective reports made by a patient.:The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

Concepts.definition: Subjective reports made by a patient.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Self-identify as African Amer
ReferenceDocuments.description: Self-identify as African American/black, non-Hispanic OR white, non-Hispanic; Participants are considered African American for recruitment purposes if they (1) identify solely as African American for race OR (2) identify as African American and white for race, but do not identify as also being of another race. Participants are considered white for recruitment purposes if they select white and no other race. (These identities are based on participant self-report during the screening process.)

ReferenceDocuments.name: OPEN Checklist
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient self-identify their race as Black, African American, or of African descent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC21038
ReferenceDocuments.description: Self-identify as African/African American/Black (AA), or European American/Caucasian/white (EA) Patients may identify a Hispanic/Latino ethnicity in combination with an AA or EA racial identity
